snippet: More than 150 bands are expected to perform at the annual music festival that starts on Jan. 10. The highly celebrated charity event has raised more than $3 million for research on Parkinson’s disease.
abstract: Light of Day Winterfest, annual multi-day rock-and-roll fundraising concert, will commemorate its 16th anniversary in January with Sweet Little 16 celebration offering over 150 acts at 30 sites, with many events occurring in Asbury Park, New Jersey; founded by music scene fixtures Tony Pallagrosi and Bob Benjamin, festival has raised over $3 million for Parkinson's disease (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: More than 150 bands are expected to perform at the annual music festival that starts on Jan. 10. The highly celebrated charity event has raised more than $3 million for research on Parkinson’s disease.

headline.print_headline: Days of Rock, for a Good Cause
headline.main: Rock Out for a Good Cause at Light of Day Winterfest
